definitions.text: (psychology) the conscious exclusion of unacceptable thoughts or desires
(physiology) the process whereby nerves can retard or prevent the functioning of an organ or part
examples: the inhibition of the heart by the vagus nerve

definitions.text: the action of prohibiting or inhibiting or forbidding (or an instance thereof)
examples: they were restrained by a prohibition in their charter
a medical inhibition of alcoholic beverages
